items.title: Tribe clinches second straight AL Central title
items.summary: The Indians did their part with an 8-4 win over the Royals on Saturday afternoon, and with the Blue Jays beating the Twins hours later, Cleveland secured its second straight American League Central title.
items.content: The Indians did their part with an 8-4 win over the Royals on Saturday afternoon, and with the Blue Jays beating the Twins hours later, Cleveland secured its second straight American League Central title.

alternate.title: Tribe clinches second straight AL Central title

items.title: Davies' struggles drop Crew 4 back of Cubs
items.summary: Miller Park sure felt like home to the Marlins on Saturday night.
items.content: Miller Park sure felt like home to the Marlins on Saturday night.

alternate.title: Davies' struggles drop Crew 4 back of Cubs

items.title: White Sox strike early, coast to win over Tigers
items.summary: Nicky Delmonico and Matt Davidson homered, Tim Anderson set a career high with four hits and Alen Hanson scored three times, pacing the White Sox to their second offensive onslaught in three days at Comerica Park for a 10-4 win over the Tigers on Saturday.
items.content: Nicky Delmonico and Matt Davidson homered, Tim Anderson set a career high with four hits and Alen Hanson scored three times, pacing the White Sox to their second offensive onslaught in three days at Comerica Park for a 10-4 win over the Tigers on Saturday.

alternate.title: White Sox strike early, coast to win over Tigers

items.title: The Twins-Blue Jays game couldn't begin until Byron Buxton closed the bullpen door
items.summary: Twins game didn't start until Buxton closed the door

items.title: Listen to Jarrod Saltalamacchia's scary ghost story during the Red Sox broadcast
items.summary: Saltalamacchia's ghost story is pretty creepy
items.content: Gather around kids, it's story time.

items.title: Cobb baffled by balk, upset by non-strike call
items.summary: Confusion and frustration struck the Rays in the sixth inning when Alex Cobb got called for a balk and later did not get a strike-three call on a pitch that appeared to be a strike.
items.content: Confusion and frustration struck the Rays in the sixth inning when Alex Cobb got called for a balk and later did not get a strike-three call on a pitch that appeared to be a strike.

alternate.title: Cobb baffled by balk, upset by non-strike call

items.title: Yanks shuffle rotation to spare CC on Jays' turf
items.summary: By shuffling their upcoming rotation, the Yankees ensured that CC Sabathia will avoid another assignment on the Rogers Centre turf, while also depriving the Twins of an advance look at Luis Severino before they could potentially see the right-hander in the American League Wild Card Game.
items.content: By shuffling their upcoming rotation, the Yankees ensured that CC Sabathia will avoid another assignment on the Rogers Centre turf, while also depriving the Twins of an advance look at Luis Severino before they could potentially see the right-hander in the American League Wild Card Game.

alternate.title: Yanks shuffle rotation to spare CC on Jays' turf

items.title: Moore happy he'll return to Giants in 2018
items.summary: A seemingly predictable morning turned into a pleasant surprise for Giants starter Matt Moore on Saturday. Anna Orlando, Moore's girlfriend, was perusing social media when she stumbled on news that the Giants would pick up the 2018 option on his contract.
items.content: A seemingly predictable morning turned into a pleasant surprise for Giants starter Matt Moore on Saturday. Anna Orlando, Moore's girlfriend, was perusing social media when she stumbled on news that the Giants would pick up the 2018 option on his contract.

alternate.title: Moore happy he'll return to Giants in 2018

items.title: Almora stays hot despite righty-righty matchup
items.summary: Albert Almora Jr. collected three hits on Saturday, driving in two runs in the Cubs' 4-1 win at Wrigley Field. He is now 7-for-9 with five extra-base hits and 10 RBIs in his last five games, and the majority of those at-bats have been against right-handers.
items.content: Albert Almora Jr. collected three hits on Saturday, driving in two runs in the Cubs' 4-1 win at Wrigley Field. He is now 7-for-9 with five extra-base hits and 10 RBIs in his last five games, and the majority of those at-bats have been against right-handers.

alternate.title: Almora stays hot despite righty-righty matchup

items.title: Double trouble: Mets ride 2Bs, deGrom in ATL
items.summary: Norichika Aoki notched two of the six doubles allowed by the Braves and Gavin Cecchini recorded a career-best three hits as the Mets added to R.A. Dickey's recent struggles and snapped an eight-game road losing streak with Saturday night's 7-3 win at SunTrust Park.
items.content: Norichika Aoki notched two of the six doubles allowed by the Braves and Gavin Cecchini recorded a career-best three hits as the Mets added to R.A. Dickey's recent struggles and snapped an eight-game road losing streak with Saturday night's 7-3 win at SunTrust Park.

alternate.title: Double trouble: Mets ride 2Bs, deGrom in ATL
